definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: speak (original mng. dub.; range in order Thes is conjectural and not comprehensive enough; treiben MV does not explain Ar. or Heb. usage, but only Aram. A mng. go away, sustained by Ar. dabara bihi go away with it, would best explain the four branches of usage:—(1) Ar. dabara depart, perish, IV. retreat, fig. retrograde, decline; dabrun passing away, death; As. dabâru, Pi. drive away, Bez:Orient. Diplom, Vocab., Dibbara, pest-god, Hpt. in KAT:2. 500, [[דֶּבֶר]] pestilence. (2) Ar. dbar follow behind, in time, place, or station; dobuwro0 part behind, duwbro0 back, [[דְּבִיר]] hindmost chamber of temple. (3) Syr. dbar lead, guide, cattle, sheep, government, take a wife, = Aram. [[דְּבַר]]; Syr. dobuwro0, Aram. [[דַּבָּר]] leader; Syr. duwboro0, Aram. [[דַּבָּרָא]] guidance; Syr. dabro0, Aram. [[דַּבְרָא]], Heb. [[דּׂבֶר]]; Syr. madbar, Aram. [[מַדְבְּרָא]], Heb. [[מִדְבָּר]] pasture, wilderness; Ar. dibrun, Syr. debowryto0, Aram. [[דַּבַּרְתָא]], Heb. [[דְּבוֹרָה]] swarm of bees, may be in this line, as led by their queen, so Thes. (4) Ar. dab=ara consider the end or issue (of an affair), relate (a story or tradition); dab=ara fiy consider, dab=ara 9alay plan against; Ph. [[דבר]] speak; Heb. [[דִּבֶּר]] etc. Syn. of [[אָמַר]] say, as Aram. [[מַלֵּל]] with [[אֲמַר]]; Gk. lalei=n, le/gein; Lat loqui, dicere; Germ. reden, sagen)—†
